metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1574 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 33.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.2, and Thunderbird 31.x before 31.2 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
